articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Wishes Switzerland Prosperity
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Wishes Switzerland Prosperity
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Eveline Widmer-Schlumpf, president of Switzerland, Wednesday on its national day.
					 Kim in his message expressed belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would as ever grow, wishing the country prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Mongolia
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Mongolia
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Sukhbaataryn Batbold, chairman of the Mongolian People's Party, on July 25.
					 The message said:
					
					 I would like to extend warm congratulations to you on your receiving the title of DPRK Marshal on behalf of the Mongolian People's Party and on my own behalf.
					
					 I think it represents the admiration of all Koreans for you. 
					
					 I wish you good health and happiness, hoping that the cooperation between our two parties would develop.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Senegalese Party Leader
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Senegalese Party Leader
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a congratulatory message from Mamadou Lamin Thiam, national permanent secretary of the Democratic Party of Senegal, on July 23.
					 The message said:
					
					 I was greatly excited and pleased to hear the news that you were awarded the title of DPRK Marshal.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I would like to extend the warmest congratulations to you on behalf of all members of the Democratic Party of Senegal and on my own behalf.
					
					 Believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between our two parties would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too, in the interests common to the peoples of the two countries, I sincerely wish you good health and happiness as well as greater success in your responsible work for reunifying the country and building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from SG of Malaysian Party
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from SG of Malaysian Party
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor, secretary general of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia (UMNOM), on July 23.
					 The message said:
					
					 We extend congratulations to you on your receiving of the title of DPRK Marshal in the name of the UMNOM's Supreme Council and members.
					
					 I think the conferment of the title of DPRK Marshal on you is an expression of boundless respect and absolute confidence of all the Korean people and servicepersons of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Availing ourselves of this opportunity, we heartily wish you great success in your responsible work.
					
					 Please accept our warmest congratulations and sincere greetings.

articles.title: Nepalese Party Leader Congratulates Kim Jong Un on Receiving Title of DPRK Marshal
articles.content:
Nepalese Party Leader Congratulates Kim Jong Un on Receiving Title of DPRK Marshal
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Jalanath Kanal, chairman of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), on July 24.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, on behalf of our Party Central Committee and on my own behalf, would like to extend our warm congratulations to you on the occasion the auspicious day when you received the title of DPRK Marshal on July 17, 2012.
					
					 It is my belief that the fraternal relations between our two parties and countries would develop on better terms in the future.
					
					 I wish you good health and greater success in the work for independent and peaceful reunification of the country and great national unity and final victory of the Korean revolution pioneered by the great President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia Observed
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition was opened at the Pyongyang Centre for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries under the co-sponsorship of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries (KCCRFC), the Russian embassy here and the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association on Wednesday. It was to mark the 10th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to Far Eastern region of the Russian Federation and the first anniversary of his visit to Siberian and Far Eastern regions of the federation.
					 Seen in the venues of the exhibition were portraits of Kim Jong Il who left his immortal footprints in the above-said regions in order to develop the DPRK-Russia friendship onto a new higher phase.
					
					 Displayed there were photos introducing Russia.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the KCCRFC, Ryu Kyong Il, vice-chairman of the association, officials concerned, working people in Pyongyang, and Ambassador Alexandr Timonin and staff members of the Russian embassy here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 A film show was held at the Taedongmun Cinema on the same day.
					
					 The participants watched the Korean documentary film "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il pays unofficial visit to Siberian and Far Eastern regions of Russia" (from August 20 to 25, 2011).

articles.title: Swiss Diplomatic Envoy Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Swiss Diplomatic Envoy Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Martin Weiersmuller, country director of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation here, Wednesday hosted a reception to mark the national day of Switzerland.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice foreign minister of the DPRK, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international bodies here.
					
					 Members of the Swiss Agency attended.

articles.title: Extravaganza "Arirang" Starts
articles.content:
Extravaganza "Arirang" Starts
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, raised its first curtain at the May Day Stadium on picturesque Rungna Island on Wednesday evening.
					 Its creative staff produced new scenes representing the indomitable spirit of service personnel and people dynamically advancing toward the final victory of thriving Korea under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, holding President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages, and the true appearance of the DPRK which undergoes changes everyday.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam and Yang Hyong Sop,     officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel, working people in Pyongyang, overseas Koreans and foreign guests.
					
					 Minister of Culture Hong Kwang Sun made an opening address.
					
					 When songs "Fortune of Korea" and "Do Prosper, Era of the Workers' Party" reverberated through the stadium, there appeared on the background letters "Highest tribute to the great Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il", "Highest glory to the dear respected Comrade Kim Jong Un", "Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are eternal sun of Juche", "Long live Heaven-sent illustrious commander General Kim Jong Un!", turning the stadium into a huge sea of flowers and dancers.
					
					 The performers highly praised the undying revolutionary careers and feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who built on this land a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, and demonstrated the dignity and power of the nation and glorified the 100 year-long history of Juche Korea as a proud period of great changes of the nation.
					
					 The perfect performance was highly acclaimed by the audience for the acme of human culture and art. It was featured by a good combination of music, dances, gymnastics, acrobatics and ever-changing background strong in national flavor and high in artistry and peculiar stage decors, electronic displays and laser lighting.

articles.title: National Gift Exhibition Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
National Gift Exhibition Opens in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The National Gift Exhibition associated with the boundless reverence and warm sincerity of all the compatriots for the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu was successfully built and opened at the foot of picturesque Mt. Ryongak here.
					 The Exhibition has a general review room where there is a full-length picture of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 On display there are precious gifts to the peerlessly great men from service personnel and people of the DPRK, the General Association of Koreans Residents in Japan and other overseas compatriots and south Korean people from all walks of life in accordance of the times, regions and social standings. 
					
					 The peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu made sure that the gifts are provided as wealth of Korea, national treasure and possession of the people.
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place on Wednesday.
					
					 Attending it were Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, officials of the party, power organs, ministries and national institutions and affiliated units, soldier builders and working people in the city.
					
					 At the ceremony Premier of the Cabinet Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), read a congratulatory message to the soldier builders, officials, members of shock brigades and helpers who performed brilliant labor feats in the construction of the Exhibition from the C.C., WPK. 
					
					 The message said the National Gift Exhibition was completed in the year marking the centenary of the birth of the President, offering a powerful educational centre for conveying long to posterity the undying feats and greatness of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu who are enjoying boundless reverence of the entire nation.
					
					 The Central Committee of the WPK in the message highly appreciated the soldier builders, officials, shock brigade members and helpers for their feats of splendidly building another grand hall praising the great persons.
					
					  Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK, in an opening address stressed the need to hold in high esteem Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as the eternal leaders of the WPK and revolution and glorify long their immortal revolutionary careers and feats. He also called for becoming genuine Songun revolutionary comrades-in-arms who protect the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the risk of their lives and faithfully upholding the idea and leadership of the party.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: War Veterans Vow to Remain Loyal to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
War Veterans Vow to Remain Loyal to Kim Jong Un
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- War veteran delegates to the celebrations of the 59th War Victory Day expressed their feelings and resolution before leaving Pyongyang on Wednesday to return home.
					 During their stay in Pyongyang, they spent happy days under the meticulous care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 At Pyongyang Airport, Ri Kuk Bok, an 83-year-old war veteran, told KCNA:
					
					 "The Party and the government have heaped special favors on the war veterans so far. During the celebrations Marshal Kim Jong Un showed deep care for us, war veterans, ranging from daily routine to lodging and boarding.
					
					 Back home, I will strive to contribute to building a socialist thriving nation."
					
					 Kim Tong Ho, an 82-year-old war veteran, said:
					
					 "I was touched so much by the deep loving care shown by Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 I will fulfill my obligations as a war veteran by telling the rising generations about his greatness and noble virtues."
					
					 Kim Yong Suk, an 80-year-old war veteran who took part in the battle on the Height 351, said:
					
					 "We had honor of having a photo session with Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un. With this honor, I will tell my descendants to work hard for the country."
					
					 Ri Won U, an 80-year-old war veteran, said:
					
					 "The celebrations were held in attendance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I will steadily urge my children to be intensely loyal to his leadership so as to repay his loving care for us, war veterans."

articles.title: War Veteran Delegates Warmly Seen Off by Pyongyangites
articles.content:
War Veteran Delegates Warmly Seen Off by Pyongyangites 
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The war veteran delegates to celebrations of the 59th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War Wednesday left Pyongyang for home amid warm send-off of senior party, state and army officials, service members and citizens.
					 Citizens from all walks of life lined up along streets here to give warm send-off to those who showed that true patriotism lies in devotedly defending the leader and the country in the days of the hard-fought war.
					
					 The farewell-bidders expressed profound respect and trust in the war veterans.
					
					 Officials and employees of the April 25 Hotel, lodgings of the war veterans, warmly saw them off.
					
					 Lines of buses with the veterans aboard arrived at Jonsung Square amid the warm sendoff of a large number of servicepersons standing along Hero Street.
					
					 Those present there included Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yong Chun and Ri Myong Su and officials of armed forces bodies.
					
					 Citizens and students and children stood along the routes and waved their hands to the war veterans who were leaving after receiving the great loving care shown by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop, Pak To Chun and other senior party and state officials and officials of the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and citizens here and youth and students saw off the old people who were leaving here by air, bus and train.
					
					 Upon arrival at their destinations, the war veterans visited statues of President Kim Il Sung and the portraits of the smiling peerlessly great persons to pay tribute to them. They vowed to fulfill their mission as the revolutionary forerunners in the drive for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 They were heartily greeted by officials, comrades-in-arms, family members and relatives in their localities.

articles.title: Voices of War Veteran Delegates Leaving Pyongyang
articles.content:
Voices of War Veteran Delegates Leaving Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- War veteran delegates left the capital city of Pyongyang by train on Wednesday after attending the celebrations of the 59th War Victory Day.
					 Prior to departure, they gave impressions of their happy days in Pyongyang.
					
					 Hwang Yun Hong, 81, a war veteran, told KCNA:
					
					 "We had an honor of having a photo session with respected Marshal Kim Jong Un and enjoying a celebration performance of the Moranbong Band in his presence.
					
					 His benevolent image reminded us of the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung in marshal's uniform standing on the platform of the meeting held to celebrate the war victory 59 years ago.
					
					 To see Kim Jong Un nearby was my only wish, and it was realized during the celebrations."
					
					 O Song Min, 79, a war veteran, said:
					
					 "The dear respected Kim Jong Un is a great man identical to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I will always keep in my mind the honor I had in the celebrations and lead all my family to be faithful to his Songun (military-first) leadership."
					
					 Kang Ki Gyun, 77, a war veteran, ardently called upon the Pyongyang citizens to strive for security and health of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Kim Hi Dong, 78, a war veteran, said:
					
					 "Five nights and six days we spent in Pyongyang will remain in my memory forever. Back home, I will tell my family, relatives and friends about those significant days.
					
					 I'll live up to Marshal Kim Jong Un's trust in the war veterans."

articles.title: War Veteran Delegates Back Home
articles.content:
War Veteran Delegates Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- War veteran delegates left here Wednesday to return home after attending the celebrations of the 59th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 All of them felt gratitude to the dear respected Kim Jong Un, who initiated the celebrations and took deep care of them during their stay in Pyongyang.
					
					 Ju Jae Hyon, 79, a war veteran, told KCNA:
					
					 "The days in Pyongyang will remain long in my memory. We, delegates, had the honor of having a photo session with Marshal Kim Jong Un. He gave all blessings to us, saying that the war veterans are priceless treasures.
					
					 Born in south Korea, I joined the Korean People's Army at the age of 17 to fight against the invaders in the war. And I had been active as an educator for many years, leading a worthwhile life under the loving care of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il."
					
					 Kim Hi Chon, 81, a war veteran, said:
					
					 "During the celebrations, we enjoyed a fireworks display and performance of Moranbong Band and toured the Rungna People's Pleasure Ground.
					
					 Back home, I'll tell my family and villagers about the happy days I spent in Pyongyang so that they could know well the loving care shown by Marshal Kim Jong Un for us war veterans."
					
					 Another war veteran Ri Kon Song, 82, said the war veterans' life has become more worthwhile as Marshal Kim Jong Un takes care of them in a responsible manner.

articles.title: Kim Un Guk Rises to Weightlifting Star
articles.content:
Kim Un Guk Rises to Weightlifting Star
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Un Guk, a weightlifter of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, won the men's 62 kg category title at the London Olympics on Monday.
					 Prior to the Olympic Games, the Goldman Sachs Investment Bank of the U.S. forecasted in its report that the DPRK would leave London with no gold medal. The forecast was made in consideration of a per capita income of each country.
					
					 The U.S. newspaper USA Today, Australian newspaper Herald Sun and other Western media guessed that only Kim Un Guk among DPRK athletes would snatch a silver medal in London.
					
					 But, the DPRK garnered three gold medals as of today, one in women's judo and another two in men's weightlifting.
					
					 Media of south Korea and the world said that the world's attention is focused on the successes by the DPRK delegation of 56 athletes and they are making a rush of wind in the London Olympics.
					
					 Their successes represent the inexhaustible strength of the DPRK, which can never be gauged by the Western view of value and criterion.

articles.title: DPRK's Olympic Athletes in Limelight of World Media
articles.content:
DPRK's Olympic Athletes in Limelight of World Media
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Athletes of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have become a focus of world media for their good results in London Olympiad.
					 Reuters, BBC and other media of UK and media of China, Russia, the United States, Japan and other countries have introduced DPRK athletes' achievements in the Olympic Games.
					
					 AP of the U.S. reported that the DPRK was winning in a big way and its flag was raised in the ExCel center for the second consecutive day.
					
					 On July 30 south Korea's Economic Daily said that the DPRK places sixth in the total standing of the ongoing Olympiad three days after its start though an American sports magazine predicted it would take only one silver medal.
					
					 Leading media of south Korea, too, reported that the DPRK won three gold and one bronze medals in four days after the start of the Olympiad to take the fourth place in its total standing by demonstrating a great power in weightlifting.
					
					 China's Xinhua and Russia's ITAR-TASS reported in detail about the DPRK athletes' successes, praising its rapid progress in sports.
					
					 Those media said that the secret of the DPRK athletes' victory is deep concern of leader Kim Jong Il and strength, courage and deep trust from the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Woman Weight-lifter Bags Olympic Gold
articles.content:
DPRK Woman Weight-lifter Bags Olympic Gold
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK woman weight-lifter Rim Jong Sim came first in the woman's 69-kg category at London Olympics, grabbing gold. 
					 She lifted 115 kg and 146 kg respectively in snatch and clean-and-jerk events on Wednesday.

articles.title: Downpours Damage Some Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Downpours Damage Some Areas of DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Downpours swept some east and west coastal areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on July 29-30, leaving 31 people dead and 16 missing.
					 The casualties were caused by landslides and thunderbolts in Kaechon and Tokchon cities of South Phyongan Province, Nyongwon County of North Phyongan Province and other areas.
					
					 The rain-triggered flood destroyed or damaged more than 4 900 dwelling houses, submerged 8 530 houses, leaving 21 370 people homeless throughout the country.
					
					 At least 15 370 hectares of cropland were flooded, buried or washed away and 200 odd public and factory buildings submerged or destroyed.

articles.title: Collieries Damaged by Flood in DPRK
articles.content:
Collieries Damaged by Flood in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Recent flood brought devastating damage to some collieries in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to estimated data, more than 179 000 tonnes of coal were washed away and 200 odd pieces of equipment and scores of pits submerged at coal mines in the Kaechon Area Coal Mine Complex and Tokchon Area Coal Mine Complex.
					
					 The flood left dozens of people dead or injured and 4 000 dwelling houses submerged.
					
					 More than 80 spots of conveyers were broken down and sections of railways, roads and bridges washed away to hinder the coal transport.
					
					 Rehabilitation materials are now supplied preferentially to those flood-stricken coal mines.

articles.title: Schoolchildren's Poems, Songs Presented
articles.content:
Schoolchildren's Poems, Songs Presented
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- There was schoolchildren's poem and song stage "The country is the embrace of the general" at the Central Youth Hall on Wednesday to mark the 60th anniversary of the creation of classic masterpiece "Embrace of Country" by leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Words of song "Embrace of Country" wrote by Kim Jong Il in 1952 is a classic masterpiece instilling the immutable truth that the embrace of the country is precisely that of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Put on the stage were narration and chorus "Embrace of Country" and other numbers.
					
					  In such numbers as narration poem "We yearn for embrace of Kim Jong Il" and three-people poem "In bitter December", the performers truthfully depicted the ardent yearning of schoolchildren for Kim Jong Il who worked heart and soul for the country and the people and the bright future of the rising generations.
					
					 Present there were Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned and schoolchildren in the city of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Songdowon International Children's Camping Starts
articles.content:
Songdowon International Children's Camping Starts
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of receiving the 27th batch of campers at the Songdowon International Children's Camp took place on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Kil Chol Hyok, vice-chairman of the C.C., the youth league, Chae Il Ryong, vice-chairman of the Kangwon Provincial People's Committee, officials concerned and campers' groups of Russia, China, Mongolia and Vietnam and the campers' group of Korean schoolchildren.
					
					 Participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the camp before paying tribute to him. 
					
					 A congratulatory address, a report and speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 During the camping the campers will train their body and mind and deepen feelings of friendship while conducting sea activities, sports and amusement games, "day of nation" and other colorful extracurricular activities.

articles.title: Local Industry Develops in Taehongdan County
articles.content:
Local Industry Develops in Taehongdan County
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Big strides have been made in the development of local industry in Taehongdan County, Ryanggang Province in the northern part of Korea this year marking the 50th anniversary of the joint meeting of local party and economic officials in Changsong County convened by President Kim Il Sung.
					 Kim Song Il, vice-chairman of the Taehongdan County People's Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 "The county has built up minor power stations and updated all its factories with its own effort.
					
					 It also made a big progress in establishing the rotation production system in stockbreeding and potato farming.
					
					 The Taehongdan Potato Processing Factory began producing vinegar with potato by-products. The factory turns out varieties of processed potato products including soy, beer, sweet jelly and soda.
					
					 The county has succeeded in improving the quality of soap at a chemical factory.
					
					 I will work harder to turn the county into a well-off area, mindful of the tireless efforts made by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to better the livelihood of the people in mountainous areas."

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea Can Never Evade Legal Responsibility for Recently Attempted Terrorism: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea Can Never Evade Legal Responsibility for Recently Attempted Terrorism: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean authorities hatched a plot to destroy inviolable statues, symbolic of the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, and its grand monuments. This is thrice-cursed monstrous terrorism. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.  
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime can never evade the legal responsibility for this attempted terrorism, a wanton violation of international law, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The above-said attempt at subversive and sabotage activities is a repetition of the trite mode of state-sponsored, politically-motivated terrorism of the U.S. engrossed in aggression, killing, plunder and destruction in different parts of the world.
					
					 The U.S. has long watched for a chance to occupy the whole of Korea by invading the DPRK. The recent incident goes to clearly prove that the U.S. is keen to stifle the DPRK at any cost and realize its ambition for domination by hiring such pro-American stooges steeped in confrontation with fellow countrymen to the marrow of their bones as traitor Lee Myung Bak. The attempted terrorism was part of the sinister scenario worked out by the puppet regime to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, pursuant to the U.S. ever-more pronounced hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 As far as the Lee group of traitors is concerned, they ceased to be Koreans long ago. They are disqualified to remain within the nation for their indelible crimes. 
					
					 All the service personnel and people of the DPRK are fully determined to ferret out without fail all those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the nation and give vent to their pent-up grudge by scouring all parts of this world no matter where they go in hiding. The enemies will come to understand this firm will to take revenge upon them.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S. Deployment of MRAP in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S. Deployment of MRAP in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- It was recently reported that the U.S. warmongers inducted MRAPs into their forces in south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					These vehicles reportedly capable of protecting troops aboard from mines or explosives are aimed at safely crossing the Military Demarcation Line before mounting an all-out attack on the DPRK once they kick off a war against it.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are mulling using such vehicles in the projected Ulji Freedom Guardian in south Korea.
					
					 This clearly shows how reckless they are going to unleash a war in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 What merits particular attention is that they plan to draw into the projected saber-rattling even military personnel of those countries that had dispatched their troops to the Korean War under the berets of the "UN forces".
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet regime's reckless  arms buildup and joint military maneuvers are driving the situation in the peninsula to the brink of a war.
					
					 It is the invariable scenario of the U.S. imperialists to mount a surprise attack on the DPRK from the sky, land and seas.
					
					 Their forward deployment of such latest type military hardware is an anachronistic action of disturbing peace and stability in the region.
					
					 With no military threat can they browbeat the Korean people. 
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK remain unshakable in their will to punish the aggressors and provocateurs and protect the dignity and sovereignty of the nation.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces Japan's Moves to Use Space for Its Military Purposes
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces Japan's Moves to Use Space for Its Military Purposes
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Some days ago the bill on the revision of the Law on Space Mechanism passed the House of Councilors of Japan by a majority vote. The previous definition that the activities of the mechanism for the research and development of aerospace are for "peaceful purposes" was deleted from the law.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: The revised law remarkably widened the sphere of moves for turning Japan into a military power, bringing to light the ulterior intention of the Japanese reactionaries to create favorable conditions for realizing their militaristic ambition for overseas expansion.
					
					 Their intention to use outer space for their military purposes is a grave threat to the global peace and security and a wanton violation of international law, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Japan felt the need to develop nuclear delivery means after acquiring the technology to produce nuclear weapons, prompted by its deeply rooted ambition to go nuclear. Hence, it has been engrossed in indigenously developing prototype rockets including H-2, H-2A and H-2B which are technologically capable of operating as nuclear carrier rockets in case of contingency.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' extension of the sphere of the moves for converting Japan into a military giant even to space is designed to develop space weapons so that they may effectively use them for military operations for future overseas invasion.
					
					 Japan's moves for militarizing space are bringing about a change in the structure of military confrontation as evidenced by the upsetting of equilibrium of forces in East Asia. This leads to an arms race and the escalation of the tension.
					
					 No wonder, the neighboring countries of Japan and the international community watched the revision of its Law on Space Mechanism with nervousness and caution. 
					
					 Intolerable are the moves of the Japanese reactionaries to turn the peaceful space into a theatre of war.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses S. Korean Opposition Party Officials of Hurting Dignity of DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses S. Korean Opposition Party Officials of Hurting Dignity of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Candidates who are running for presidency on tickets of opposition parties of south Korea recently spoke ill of the DPRK, misleading the public opinion. They said the "north is making nuclear development", "it can not be seen as a normal state", "it is necessary to improve the north's human rights" and the like, according to Minju Joson Wednesday in a bylined commentary.
					 The reckless remarks made by them are nothing but an undisguised betrayal of democratic forces as they are siding with the traitorous regime's moves of escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen while finding fault with the social system in the DPRK, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 People are rising up in an organized manner across south Korea to retake the nation's dignity, reunify Korea by improving the inter-Korean relations and enjoy a worthy life as human beings. This clearly reflects the south Koreans' mind-set.
					
					 Some officials concerned of opposition parties are, however, slandering compatriots in the north, turning their faces away from such public mind-set. This means they have bent their knees to the conservative group, afraid of its racket of "eliminating the forces following the north".
					
					 Matter is that they are utterly ignorant of the DPRK. The DPRK never pardons anyone who defames its dignity and social system.
					
					 It will view those who hurt its dignity and social system just like the group of traitors and ignore them forever.
					
					 The above-said figures had better stop their groundless remarks for the sake of themselves.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Terms Japan Very Stingy
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Terms Japan Very Stingy
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- It was reported shortly ago that the German government agreed to pay compensation worth hundreds of millions of U.S. dollars to Jews in the former Soviet Union who survived World War II.
					 The international community is duly appreciating Germany for making sincere repentance and compensation to the Jewish victims after recognizing its moral and historical responsibility for what was done against them.
					
					 This good behavior of Germany once again brought Japan's attitude towards its past crimes into bolder relief, sparking off strong criticism of the international community.
					
					 In the first half of the last century Japan forcibly took away more than 8.4 million young and middle-aged Koreans from their country alone and massacred at least a million of them. It forced more than 200 000 Korean women into sexual slavery, savagely violating their chastity and killing them in cold-blood.
					
					 This was the most hideous crimes against humanity among the crimes perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean nation.
					
					 Nevertheless, Japan has justified its history of aggression against Korea, far from admitting its crimes in the wartime. Japan claims it made a "contribution" to the development of the Korean nation, a serious insult to it.
					
					 The world is stunned by Japan's approach towards the issue of "comfort women", in particular.
					
					 Through the rewriting of school textbooks Japan attempted to delete the expression of "comfort women" and gloss over the issue of sexual slavery through such farce as "compensation" with the fund raised by people.
					
					 Of late Japan refuses to admit this. It has gone the lengths of rubbing salt into the wounds of victims by making such reckless remarks as "they were voluntary" and "it was just a history of bathrooms ", not content with jabbering that "they were deeds of individual businessmen". 
					
					 A Japanese diplomat attempted to bribe Americans in a bid to get a monument to comfort women in New Jersey State removed only to be chided by the world again. 
					
					 Voices critical of that behavior and calling for severe punishment of Japan are heard even from U.S. Congress.
					
					 Japan is characterized not only by political and moral vulgarity but by the height of shameless and brazen-faced nature.
					
					 This is the main reason why Japan is now finding itself in such bottomless political dilemma inside and outside, rebuffed by the international community, though it once talked a lot about "economic prosperity."
					
					 Its base attitude denying its crime-woven history resulted in throwing all fabrics of its society into mayhem and rendering it depraved politically and morally.
					
					 Japan has, therefore, no future.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Warns Some S. Korean Opposition Politicians of Their Anti-DPRK Remarks
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Warns Some S. Korean Opposition Politicians of Their Anti-DPRK Remarks
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Some politicians of opposition parties of south Korea were reported recently to have let loose a spate of invectives daring hurt the dignity and social system of the DPRK while making election commitments and clarifying their political stands.
					 A presidential candidate from the Democratic United Party on July 16 asserted at a press conference that "the north needs an option for reforms and it would meet the same fate as Libya's".
					
					 A spokesman for the Democratic United Party and the representative of the Unified Progressive Party talked such rubbish as "hereditary politics" and "human rights issue".
					
					 What they uttered are unpardonable politically-motivated provocations as they mean joining the conservative group in south Korea in the confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 The forces of opposition parties once enjoyed certain political support as they called for improving the inter-Korean relations, opposed to the confrontation policy of the conservative group.
					
					 But they are now busy dancing on a political rope, torn apart, instead of getting united on the basis of a correct political viewpoint. That is why they have failed to receive due support from the people.
					
					 Some of them make no scruple of uttering any words in a bid to gratify their political greed while yielding to the conservative group's racket for "eliminating forces following the north" or reading its face.
					
					 They just betray their disgusting true colors as wavering political servants bereft of any political creed.
					
					 They are sadly mistaken if they calculate they can gain popularity by hurling mud at the DPRK and win the "presidential election." 
					
					 The DPRK will never allow anybody to hurt its dignity and social system and will never deal with such guys.
					
					 The DPRK will remain unchanged in this principled stand whoever may come to power in south Korea.
					
					 Those who recklessly join the conservative group in its moves to escalate the confrontation with compatriots are bound to meet a miserable end, rebuffed and condemned by justice.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Peruvian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted on its website the full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" on July 25.
					 The work, made public on August 4, 1997, clarifies the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung for national reunification and formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 The work also indicates tasks and ways for reunifying the country on the basis of the charters.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by French Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by French Organization
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association carried the full text of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun" on its bulletin on July 20.
					 The speech made by Kim Jong Un on April 15, 2012 clarifies that the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves an immutable truth that an outstanding leader assures the dignity and prosperity of the country and nation.
					
					 It also clarifies an idea that the history of victory made by the Korean People's Army guarantees the glorious 100-year history of Juche Korea and the eternal history of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea. 
					
					 The speech indicates tasks for glorifying the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully building a thriving socialist country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Congratulated by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Congratulated by Foreign Personages 
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Personages of Bangladesh and Myanmar made public statements on July 23 and 24 congratulating the dear respected Kim Jong Un upon receiving the title of DPRK Marshal. 
					 Khaleq Zaman Bhuiyan, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, said that the title of DPRK Marshal awarded to Kim Jong Un is an expression of boundless reverence and trust in the peerlessly great man by the army and people of the DPRK 
					
					 "The members of our party believe that under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un the army and people of the DPRK will achieve bigger successes in the effort for building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country," he noted. 
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said that the conferment of the title of DPRK Marshal upon Kim Jong Un is the reflection of the unanimous wishes of all the members of the Workers' Party of Korea, servicepersons and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Un the army and people of the DPRK will more dynamically advance for the building of a thriving nation and the reunification of Korea, holding President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal leaders, he added. 
					
					 The chairman of the International Commerce Promotion Center of Myanmar extended warm congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un upon the auspicious event and expressed support and solidarity with the Workers' Party of Korea and the people of the DPRK in their effort for building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: DPRK's War Victory Day Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's War Victory Day Marked in Different Countries 
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- A seminar, book and photo exhibition and film show took place in India and film shows in Uganda and Indonesia on July 24 and 25 to mark the 59th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 On display in the venues of the events were books and photos showing feats of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Korean films were shown at the film shows. 
					
					 The chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India said that the great victory of the Korean people in the war was attributable to the wise leadership of the President. 
					
					 The undying feats the President performed by shattering the myth of "mightiness" of the U.S. imperialists who  boasted of being "the strongest" in the world and bringing about the beginning of downhill turn for the U.S. would shine forever, he stressed. 
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean regime ignite another war on the Korean Peninsula, they will meet their final end, he warned. 
					
					 The chairman of the Kampala City Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement said after watching a Korean film that he could know well that the U.S. was the very criminal who provoked the Korean War. 
					
					 It was a noteworthy miracle in the world history of wars that the DPRK less than two years old won a victory in the war against the U.S. and its allies, he said. 
					
					 Noting that the Korean People's Army under the command of the dear respected Kim Jong Un is demonstrating its might as an invincible army, he extended warm congratulations to him upon receiving the title of DPRK Marshal.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korea's Attempted Terrorism against DPRK Denounced Abroad
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korea's Attempted Terrorism against DPRK Denounced Abroad 
						
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea, contributed an article to the Jordanian newspaper Al-Diyar on July 23 in which he condemned the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet regime for attempting heinous terrorism against the DPRK. 
					 The article accused the U.S. and its allies of hatching world-shocking plots against the DPRK, conveying accounts of a recent press conference held with a terrorist who was arrested while attempting to destroy statues in the DPRK. 
					
					 The press conference accused the U.S. and its stooges of openly interfering in internal affairs of the DPRK, throwing them into a tight corner, and dealt a heavy blow at the U.S. and its followers, the article noted, and continued:
					
					 The U.S. Administration and intelligence agencies provide the anti- DPRK plot-breeding organizations with a huge amount of fund every year. This is clearly proved by the fact that the "special envoy for the human rights issue in north Korea" of the U.S. State Department said during his south Korea trip in June that the U.S. would provide 10 million U.S. dollars to those organizations active for destabilizing the DPRK this year. 
					
					 Hideous subversive and sabotage activities against the DPRK are war actions little short of direct invasion of it. 
					
					 The U.S. and south Korea are wholly to blame for having strained the situation on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 It is quite impossible for the DPRK to dismantle its nukes under the present situation. 
					
					 The DPRK will comprehensively reexamine the nuclear issue and steadily bolster up nuclear deterrence to frustrate the moves of all those meddlers and their stooges and defend the dignity and sovereignty of the country.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Finnish Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Finnish Figure
 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, made public a statement on July 25 to mark the 59th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 The statement said that the U.S. imperialists suffered defeat in the Korean War for the first time in its history of aggression wars.
					
					 The DPRK's victory in the war was the fruition of the brilliant military strategy and idea of President Kim Il Sung, who wisely led the just struggle of the Korean people, it said, and went on:
					
					 Under the wise guidance of the President the Korean people created world-startling miracles in the post-war rehabilitation and construction and built a powerful country through strenuous efforts for socialist construction. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il took deep care of the war veterans and his love is being carried forward by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The conferment of the title of DPRK Marshal upon Kim Jong Un is the reflection of the unanimous desire of the Korean people to accomplish the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the eternal leaders, and their boundless reverence for him. 
					
					 The Finland-Korea Society strongly demands the U.S. end at once its illegal military presence in south Korea, make an apology for the crimes committed during the Korean War and respond to the proposal for signing a peace agreement as early as possible.

articles.title: Funcionario de Taehongdan se entrevista con la ACNC
articles.content:
Funcionario de Taehongdan se entrevista con la ACNC
						
Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- "Este ano se cumplen 50 anos desde cuando el Presidente         Kim Il Sung convoco la historica Conferencia Conjunta en Changsong. En cumplimiento de las tareas presentadas en esa ocasion, se produce ahora gran avance en el desarrollo de industria local y la mejora de la vida popular de Taehongdan."
					Asi dijo a la ACNC el vicepresidente del Comite Popular del Distrito de Taehongdan de la provincia de Ryanggang, Kim Song Il (57 anos de edad), y continuo:
					
					Construimos con las fuerzas propias de nuestro distrito las centrales hidroelectricas de mediano y pequeno tamanos y aceleramos la modernizacion tecnica de los equipos. 
					
					Por eso, nos estamos beneficiando mucho de la industria local en curso de desarrollo.
					
					Se alcanzo notable avance tambien en el establecimiento del sistema de reciclaje entre la ganaderia, la produccion de fertilizante y la de cereales y carne.
					
					Miles de toneladas de los residuos de procesamiento de patata, que se obtienen cada ano en la Fabrica de Elaboracion de Patata, sirven de alimento para los cerdos y el estiercol generado en las granjas ganaderas se echan a los patatales en una cantidad de mas de 10 toneladas por cada hectarea.
					
					En la Fabrica de Elaboracion de Patata de Taehongdan, se normaliza la produccion de vinagre fermentado hecho con materias residuales de papa.
					
					Se acondicionaron en ella los procesos de produccion de varios alimentos como salsa, cerveza, jalea y bebida carbonatada.
					
					Por otra parte, modernizamos el proceso de produccion de jabon de la fabrica quimica y mejoramos asi la calidad de ese articulo de aseo que se distribuye mensualmente a los habitantes del distrito.
					
					Tomando como ejemplo la vida de los grandes hombres sin pares quienes dedicaron todo lo suyo para mejorar la vida de los habitantes de zonas montanosas, seguiremos trabajando mucho mas para convertir nuestro distrito en un lugar ideal para vivir.

articles.title: Conmemoran en Corea aniversario 60 de la obra de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Conmemoran en Corea aniversario 60 de la obra de Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este miercoles en la Casa Central de la Juventud el recital de poesia y cancion de los escolares "La Patria es el regazo del General" dedicado al 60o aniversario de la creacion de la obra maestra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "Regazo de la Patria".
					La cancion creada en 1952 es la obra maestra clasica que difunde al ejercito y el pueblo una verdad de que el Generalisimo Kim Il Sung es la patria.
					
					Se presentaron en la ocasion varias piezas tales como la narracion y coro "Regazo de la Patria".
					
					Los interpretes de la poesia en narracion "Anoramos el regazo del General padre", la poesia recitada en trio "En diciembre", etc. describieron emocionantemente la ferviente anoranza de los ninos escolares de todo el pais al Dirigente Kim Jong Il que dedicaron para la patria, el pueblo y el brillante futuro de las generaciones venideras.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Ri Yong Su, jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Jon Yong Nam, presidente del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, Kim Sung Du, presidente del Comite de Educacion, los funcionarios interesados y los ninos escolares capitalinos.

articles.title: Actos dedicados al dia de visita a Rusia de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Actos dedicados al dia de visita a Rusia de Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- La galeria de fotos dedicada al 10o aniversario de la visita del Dirigente Kim Jong Il a la region del Lejano Oriente de la Federacion Rusa y al 1o de su visita a Siberia y el Lejano Oriente fue inaugurada este miercoles en el Centro de Intercambio Cultural con el Extranjero de Pyongyang bajo coauspicios del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, la embajada rusa en Corea y la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia.
					En la ocasion se exhiben las fotos del Dirigente quien dejo sus imborrables huellas en las regiones de Lejano Oriente y Siberia de la Federacion Rusa para desarrollar en la etapa mas alta la amistad Corea-Rusia.
					
					Ademas se ven las otras que presentan a Rusia.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ceremonia de apertura Kim Jong Suk, presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Ryu Kyong Il, vicepresidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia, los funcionarios interesados, los trabajadores capitalinos, el embajador Alexandr Timonin y otros miembros de la embajada rusa en Corea.
					
					Hubo intervenciones.
					
					El mismo dia, tuvo lugar con el mismo motivo en el Cine Taedongmun una muestra de cine.
					
					Los participantes vieron el documental coreano "Kim Jong Il en su visita extraoficial a Siberia y la region de Lejano Oriente de Rusia" (de 20 a 25 de agosto de 2011).

articles.title: Se amplian danos por sucesivos aguaceros
articles.content:
Se amplian danos por sucesivos aguaceros
						
Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- Volvieron a caer los dias 29 y 30 las lluvias torrenciales en las regiones de la costa occidental y en algunas de la costa oriental de Corea dejando saldo de 31 muertos y 16 desaparecidos.
					Se registraron las perdidas humanas a causa de derrumbe de montanas y el relampago en varias localidades incluyendo las ciudades de Kaechon y Tokchon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur y el distrito de Nyongbyon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					En toda la extension del pais, quedaron destruidas total y parcialmente mas de 4 900 viviendas, anegadas mas de 8 mil 530 edificios y mas de 21 mil 370 personas perdieron sus casas.
					
					Fueron anegadas, enterradas o perdidas mas de 15 mil 370 hectareas de tierra cultivable y anegadas o destruidas total y parcialmente mas de 200 edificios publicos y de produccion.
